intro: Youngia rosthornii, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Youngia rosthornii is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
